newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippines reopens termed reverse repo windows.
newsitem.headline: Philippines reopens termed reverse repo windows.

text.p: The Philippine Central Bank said on Monday it had reopened its termed reverse repo facilities.
The Central Bank had withdrawn its termed reverse repos last Thursday.
Its one-month reverse repos were being offered at 11.25 percent.
The two-month reverse repos were at 11.375 percent, and the three-month reverse repos at 11.5 percent.
The bank also reduced the yields on its special series Treasury bills.
The 72-day and the 79-day bills were being offered at 11.55 percent from 11.6 percent last Friday, while the 86-day bills were being sold at 11.6 percent from 11.65 percent.
